topic: How to document web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: FastAPI Documentation for Python 3.12+ Web Backends
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview of how to document REST APIs using FastAPI, a modern, easy-to-use framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI utilizes OpenAPI specification (OAS) for generating documentation
Automatic generation of client code, server stubs, and API documentation
Type annotations and Pydantic models for data validation
Routing, middleware, request/response objects, and more
Integration with popular databases (SQLAlchemy, SQLModel, Databases.SQLite, etc.)
version_notes: FastAPI 0.70.0 introduces significant performance improvements and new features
FastAPI 0.65.2 added support for SQLAlchemy ORM, and FastAPI 0.72.0 introduced SQLModel integration
caveats: Ensure your Python environment is compatible with FastAPI by checking the requirements in FastAPI's official documentation
FastAPI uses Pydantic for data validation. Familiarize yourself with Pydantic's syntax and features to make the most of FastAPI
